intro: Barleria torrei, commonly known as the Natal barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive reddish or purple hue. Its showy flowers, which are usually pink or red, are borne in clusters and attract various pollinators. Barleria torrei is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
